description: Alteration of monial (“mullion”), or metathesis of Middle English moyniel, both ultimately from Old French moinel.

entries.meaning: (architecture) A vertical bar between the panes of glass or casements of a window or the panels of a screen.

verbs.description: mullion (third-person singular simple present mullions, present participle mullioning, simple past and past participle mullioned)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To shape into divisions by means of mullions.
